places_to_visit.name: Brandenburg Gate
places_to_visit.description: The Brandenburg Gate is an iconic 18th-century neoclassical monument that has become a symbol of Berlin's reunification. It stands at the end of Unter den Linden boulevard and offers historical significance and grand architecture.

places_to_visit.name: Berlin Wall Memorial
places_to_visit.description: The Berlin Wall Memorial is a historical site that preserves a section of the Berlin Wall and provides insights into its impact on the city. It includes a documentation center and observation towers.

places_to_visit.name: Reichstag Building
places_to_visit.description: The Reichstag Building is the seat of the German Parliament. Known for its glass dome designed by Sir Norman Foster, it offers panoramic views of Berlin and represents Germany’s democratic rebirth.

places_to_visit.name: Museum Island
places_to_visit.description: Museum Island is a complex of five museums on the Spree Island, including the Pergamon Museum and the Altes Museum. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a treasure trove of art and antiquities.

places_to_visit.name: Checkpoint Charlie
places_to_visit.description: Checkpoint Charlie was the most famous crossing point between East and West Berlin during the Cold War. Today, it features a museum and replicas of border guard posts.
